intro: Haplocoelum foliolosum subsp. foliolosum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia, a common feature in the genus. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping or as a ornamental plant in dry climates.
